definitions.definition: The act of moving; a movement.
definitions.example: A slight move of the tiller, and the boat will go off course.

definitions.definition: An act for the attainment of an object; a step in the execution of a plan or purpose.
definitions.example: He made another move towards becoming a naturalized citizen.

definitions.definition: A formalized or practiced action used in athletics, dance, physical exercise, self-defense, hand-to-hand combat, etc.
definitions.example: She always gets spontaneous applause for that one move.

definitions.definition: The event of changing one's residence.
definitions.example: The move into my fiancé's house took two long days.

definitions.definition: A change in strategy.
definitions.example: I am worried about our boss's move.

definitions.definition: A transfer, a change from one employer to another.
The act of moving a token on a gameboard from one position to another according to the rules of the game.
definitions.example: If you roll a six, you can make two moves.

definitions.definition: To change place or posture; to go, in any manner, from one place or position to another.
To act; to take action; to begin to act
definitions.example: Come on guys, let's move: there's work to do!

definitions.definition: To change residence, for example from one house, town, or state, to another; to go and live at another place. See also move out and move in.
definitions.example: I decided to move to the country for a more peaceful life.

definitions.definition: (and other games) To change the place of a piece in accordance with the rules of the game.
definitions.example: My opponent's counter was moving much quicker round the board than mine.

definitions.definition: To cause to change place or posture in any manner; to set in motion; to carry, convey, draw, or push from one place to another
To transfer (a piece or man) from one space or position to another, according to the rules of the game
definitions.example: She moved the queen closer to the centre of the board.

definitions.definition: To excite to action by the presentation of motives; to rouse by representation, persuasion, or appeal; to influence.
definitions.example: This song moves me to dance.

definitions.definition: To arouse the feelings or passions of; especially, to excite to tenderness or compassion, to excite (for example, an emotion).
To propose; to recommend; specifically, to propose formally for consideration and determination, in a deliberative assembly; to submit
definitions.example: I move to repeal the rule regarding obligatory school uniform.

definitions.definition: To mention; to raise (a question); to suggest (a course of action); to lodge (a complaint).
To incite, urge (someone to do something); to solicit (someone for or of an issue); to make a proposal to.
To apply to, as for aid.
To request an action from the court.
definitions.example: An attorney moved the court to issue a restraining order.

definitions.definition: To bow or salute upon meeting.
To sell, to market (especially, but not exclusively, illegal products)
A good ability to dance.
definitions.example: Check out the guy on the dancefloor, he's got seriously good moves.
